account.title: Account Lockout
account.info: This is the number of invalid log-on attempts allowed before the account is locked out. After the defined threshold is reached, the account then becomes locked until the account lockout duration passes or an administrator manually unlocks the account.

suspecious.title: Suspecious IP Throtting
suspecious.info: Suspicious IP throttling blocks traffic from any IP address that rapidly attempts too many logins or signups

brute-force.title: Brute-Force Protection
brute-force.info: Designed to prevent credential-based attacks. Credential-based attacks rely on weak, common, or stolen identity information to impersonate legitimate users or take control of legitimate accounts

breached-password.title: Breached Password Detection
breached-password.info: Automates the detection and remediation of breached passwords. Secure apps and protect users with enterprise scale account takeover protection

tokens.title: Tokens
tokens.info: Configure tokens settings to interact securely with an application
tokens.access.token.info: Access tokens are used in token-based authentication to allow an application to access an API. The application receives an access token after a user successfully authenticates and authorizes access, then passes the access token as a credential when it calls the target API. The passed token informs the API that the bearer of the token has been authorized to access the API and perform specific actions specified by the scope that was granted during authorization
tokens.id.token.info: ID tokens are used in token-based authentication to cache user profile information and provide it to a client application, thereby providing better performance and experience. The application receives an ID token after a user successfully authenticates, then consumes the ID token and extracts user information from it, which it can then use to personalize the user's experience
tokens.refresh.token.info: A refresh token is a special kind of token used to obtain a renewed access token. You can request new access tokens until the refresh token is on the DenyList. Applications must store refresh tokens securely because they essentially allow a user to remain authenticated forever
tokens.app.token.info: Application tokens allow you to interact with a single application at a scope level you define. Using an application token, users can create, read, update or delete any resource of the application
